action.action-desc: Mr. Estes of Kansas (for himself, Mr. McCaul, and Mr. Gallagher) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Homeland Security

form.official-title: To amend the Homeland Security Act of 2002 to establish in the Department of Homeland Security a fusion center technical assistance program.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Enhancing DHS’ Fusion Center Technical Assistance Program Act.
Section 210A of the Homeland Security Act of 2002 (6 U.S.C. 124h) is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating subsections (j) and (k) as subsections (k) and (l), respectively; and
by inserting after subsection (i) the following new subsection (j):

The Secretary, in consultation with officials from the National Network of Fusion Centers and, to the greatest extent practicable, other relevant stakeholders, shall establish a fusion center technical assistance program.
In carrying out the fusion center technical assistance program established under paragraph (1), the Secretary shall—

subparagraph.text: provide technical assistance to fusion centers regarding—
provide to fusion centers notice of any changes to the activities referred to in subparagraph (A);

clause.text: information sharing and analysis of homeland security threats, including cyber threats;
protecting privacy, civil rights, and civil liberties; and
such other best practices as the Secretary determines appropriate; and

subparagraph.text: carry out such other activities as the Secretary determines appropriate.
